source_sentence: 佛說大護明大陀羅尼經
translation: Dhāraṇī of the Great Mantra Protector

source_sentence: 西天中印度摩伽陀國那爛陀寺
translation: Nālandā Temple, Magadha, Central India, Western Heaven

source_sentence: 三藏傳教大師賜紫沙門臣法天
translation: Tripiṭaka Missionary Master Granted to the Purple Monk Minister Dharma Heaven
translation of the imperial edict

source_sentence: 爾時世尊住沒哩際疏聚落。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān stayed at the monastery of Bṛhatphala.

source_sentence: 是時世尊告尊者阿難陀言。
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed Venerable Ānanda and said.

source_sentence: 阿難陀我今欲去往詣吠舍離城。
translation: "Ananta, now I want to leave and visit the city of Vaiśālī.
Venerable Ānanda said.
"Thus, Bhagavān, I will now obey your order.
The Bhagavān and Ānanda then went to the city of Vaiśālī.

source_sentence: 往吠舍離城到菴沒羅園已。
translation: They went to the city of Vaiśālī and arrived at Manor Park.
The Buddha told Ānanda.

source_sentence: 阿難陀汝可入城擇吉祥地。
translation: "Ānanda, you may enter the city and choose an auspicious place.

source_sentence: 安因陀羅枳黎駐足正念。
translation: Stand tall and correctly mindful as he guides Indrachari.

source_sentence: 說此大護明大陀羅尼及以伽陀曰。
translation: He spoke this great protective luminous great dhāraṇī and Īgadhātu, saying.

source_sentence: 尾薩囉哆(一)尾薩囉哆(二)尾薩囉哆(三)尾薩囉哆(四)尾薩囉哆(五)過現未來　正遍知者　已彼同意　度於世間　一切諸佛　一切獨覺　諸阿羅漢　及以聲聞　一切戒威德　一切真實言　乃至於大梵　迦弭自在者　帝釋及諸天　一切阿素囉　阿素囉使者　乃至部多等　一切皆同意尾薩囉哆(一)尾薩囉哆(二)尾薩囉哆(三)尾薩囉哆(四)尾薩囉哆(五)過現未來一切佛為度世間故應知。
translation: "Vissaratha(1) Vissaratha(2) Vissaratha(3) Vissaratha(3) Vissaratha(4) Vissaratha(5) Those who have agreed to pass through the world, all buddhas, all solitary realizers, arhats, śrāvakas, all precepts, authoritative qualities, all true words, even the great Brahmā, Kāmekani, Indra, and the gods, all asuras, all messengers, even the ministers, and so forth, all agree that Vissaratha(1) Vissaratha(2) Vissaratha(3) Vissaratha(4) Vissaratha(5) all buddhas in the past, present, and future should know in order to save the world.

source_sentence: 捫佐(上)哆(一)捫佐(上)哆(二)捫佐(上)哆(三)捫佐(上)哆(四)麼(上引)底瑟姹(二合)覩(五)伊(上)底尾喻(二合)跛舍(引)弭也(二合)哆(六)涅(泥逸切)[薩/女]瑳哆(上七)涅(准上)[薩/女]瑳哆(上八)天中之天天所尊重。
translation: (4) Mātṛkā (supreme) do (1) Mātṛkā (supreme) do (2) Mātṛkā (supreme) do (3) Mātṛkā (supreme) do (4) Mātṛkā (supreme) dṛṣṭi (2) tu (5) I (supreme) dṛṣṭi (2) lameśa (supreme) do (6) Nirgrantha (nirdeśa) [sa/nu] gṛdhāra (supreme) seven) Nirgrantha (supreme) [sa/nu] gṛdhāra (supreme) eight) A daily occurrence among the gods.
He enters Vaiśālī, the lord of the world, Brahmā, and the four guardian kings of Indra.
He enters Vaiśālī, the lord of the world, Brahmā, and the four world-protecting kings of Indra.
They also enter the myriad thousands of gods.
Countless numbers of asuras also came.
King Asura and the multitude of Asuras also came to enter.

source_sentence: 乃至無量千部多眾等亦復隨入。
translation: Measureless thousands of Bhūtas and multitudes of people also entered with him.
They gave their orders to the Bhagavān.
He observed the arising of calamity in all sentient beings.
When epidemics become widespread, they create accomplished dharmas.
He quickly causes them to retreat and makes them comfortable.'
The true teaching is.

source_sentence: 儞哩誐(二合)蹉哆儞哩誐(二合)蹉哆儞哩誐(二合)蹉哆儞哩誐(二合)蹉哆訖史(二合)鉢覽(二合)波羅(引)野哆野儞喻焰訥瑟吒(二合)唧哆(引)曩設野(二合)哆曳(引)昧怛囉(二合)唧哆(引)曩波覽(引)度迦(引)麼(引)囉訖產(二合引)左(引)努挽哩底(二合)迦(引)麼(引)諦(引)悉底(二合)瑟姹(勅降反二合)哆摩艮鉢囉(二合)沒吐(引)路迦(引)努劍波句(引)惹拏(二合)波野底蘇母蘇母蘇母蘇母嚕蘇母嚕蘇母嚕蘇母蘇嚕蘇嚕蘇嚕蘇嚕母母母母鉢囉(二合)尾捨底嚕蘇母　母嚕母嚕母嚕母嚕母嚕母嚕母嚕母嚕護彌　哩彌哩彌哩彌哩彌哩彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕彌哩　母嚕哩底　母嚕哩底　哩哩哩哩哩哩　彌哩彌哩彌哩彌哩彌哩彌哩　底賀悉彌　彌哩底彌哩哩彌彌迦吒　迦囉迦吒建迦囉迦囉迦佐(引)劍迦囉(引)劍迦囉(引)劍迦囉(引)劍迦囉(引)劍迦囉(引)劍迦囉(引)劍迦嚕(引)迦哩底俱哩勢(引)劍迦哩劍迦哩勢底哩底哩哩哩哩哩(引)頗娑(引)哩普哩普哩普哩普哩普哩普哩普囉曩(引)曩他(引)哩哩[口*體]普哩婆哩布薩哆(二合)阿曩(引)他(引)室左(二合)哩鉢囉(二合)儞哩誐(二合)蹉他波羅(引)野哆哩鉢覽(二合)波羅(引)野哆如來正遍知者為於世間一切眾生。
translation: "Nirigārjuna(er), Śatana(er), Śatana(er), Śatana(er), Śatana(er), Śatakushi(er), Pārāpanna(er), and Pārāpanna(er) are the words of the Tathāgata who has perfect knowledge of all the world's sentient beings and who quickly enters this place of removal of calamity for their sake.
He enters this place to remove disasters and hardships.
With great kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, he accomplishes the kārttika by speaking this true language.
He spoke this true teaching to accomplish the Gadhātu.

source_sentence: 一切聖眾乃至部多等眾。
translation: All the noble beings, even the Bhūtas and so forth.

source_sentence: 而知此法於諸世間為最為上。
translation: They then know that this teaching is the greatest and highest of all the world.

source_sentence: 若復不惜身命為於一切。
translation: Suppose he doesn't spare his own life for the sake of all people.
It stops epidemics and destroys calamities.
It will increase their good thoughts and make them happy.
He teaches the path to liberation for the rest of the world.
He teaches the teaching of respect for the Dharma.
He creates well-being for them all.

source_sentence: 為度世師為諸世間而起慈心。
translation: He'll be a teacher of the world and show compassion for the world.
He comforts all sentient beings by being like an ordinary child.
He constantly follows all sentient beings.
By being like a bright lamp, it will shine more brightly as a candle.
He causes those who are in transmigration to attain the right path.
Their knowledge of all dharmas is not lacking.
Their speech is pure, and they enjoy all kinds of pleasures.
When they're born, they'll be born into a wealthy family.
They attain great fearlessness and the accomplishment of meritorious actions.

source_sentence: 彼所生地一切震動一切有情咸皆歡喜。
translation: All the ground where they're born is shaken, and all sentient beings are delighted.
Six kinds of trembling occur in their site of enlightenment.
Māra and his people are all distressed.

source_sentence: 謂彼牟尼當轉法輪說四聖諦以調伏法降彼外道。
translation: That monk will turn the wheel of the Dharma, preach the four noble truths, and subdue those non-Buddhists with the Dharma of submission.
All sentient beings will surely become buddhas.
He'll bring comfort to humans, gods, and Indra.

source_sentence: 乃至安樂一切部多眾等。
translation: That's to say, that monk will turn the wheel of the Dharma, preach the four noble truths, subdue the Dharma and subdue those non-Buddhists.
At all times, they'll be able to see the Buddha.
Attaining the noble aspirations, they'll attain measureless merit.
The things they seek will all be accomplished.
Because they attain enlightenment, they'll be comfortable in the four paths.
It also causes sentient beings to live day and night, day and night.
And everywhere they go, they'll be completely at ease.

source_sentence: 乃至蠕動一切有情各令快樂。
translation: They even wriggle all sentient beings to make each happy.

source_sentence: 復令眾生不造惡業見諸賢聖。
translation: It also causes sentient beings not to create bad karma and to see the good and the noble.

source_sentence: 部多來集所住之地及彼虛空。
translation: They will often come to gather at the place where they live and in that space.
They always show compassion for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 於晝於夜於一切時依法而住。
translation: During day and night, they abide according to the Dharma at all times.
Venerable Ānanda then said to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 白世尊言如是世尊我今聽命。
translation: He said to the Bhagavān, "Thus, Bhagavān, now I've been instructed to obey.
After he had done so, he took refuge in Indra's Hari.

source_sentence: 為諸眾生消除災難駐足正念。
translation: He removed calamity for all sentient beings and kept correct mindfulness.

source_sentence: 說此大護明大陀羅尼成就伽陀曰。
translation: He said, "This is the accomplishment of the great dhāraṇī of great protection and insight," said Gadha.

source_sentence: 及天帝釋護世四王亦復來入。
translation: The four guardian kings of Indra and Śākyamuni also came to enter.

source_sentence: 無數賢聖無數阿素囉王無數阿素囉眾。
translation: Countless good men and sages, countless asura kings, and countless asura multitudes.
There are countless multitudes of Asuras.
They all saw the Bhagavān and declared their allegiance.

source_sentence: 當為一切眾生消除災難。
translation: They will remove disasters and calamities for all sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 儞哩誐(二合)蹉哆儞哩誐(二合)蹉哆儞哩誐(二合)蹉哆儞哩誐(二合)蹉哆若人非人起於惡心。
translation: If people or non-people develop bad intentions, they'll cause misfortune and disasters by acting unbeneficially.
Their actions are unbeneficial and cause misfortune.
They must quickly retreat and not cause further evil.
If he doesn't retreat, he'll destroy himself.
He'll always arouse compassion and vow to protect it.

source_sentence: 如來救世者應當如是知。
translation: Those who are saved by the Tathāgata should thus know.

They'll cause all sentient beings to wish to do as they please.

source_sentence: 如來以大慈大悲大喜大捨。
translation: The Tathāgata uses great kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity.
He spoke this true teaching to accomplish the Gata.
It's for all the gods and the many clans of the order.
He attains the highest wisdom and the principle of the Dharma.
He rids the world of all calamities and miasma.
He destroys the venomous errors of craving for self and others.
With that good mind, he explains all the teachings.
It causes sentient beings in the world to see the path to liberation and attain well-being.
Seeing the path to liberation, they'll attain well-being.
The Tathāgata is the teacher of the three realms.
He compassionately protects sentient beings like their youngest child.
He's also like a candle that lights up sentient beings.
Those who reside in transmigration will see the right path.
He well explains the essentials of the Dharma in words that are pure.
All demons and spirits will testify to that.
Those [sentient beings] then attain great fearlessness.

source_sentence: 處於富貴資財廣多饒益一切。
translation: They'll live in a place of wealth and possessions that are abundant and beneficial to all.
They'll attain the accomplishment of goodness and the fulfillment of merit.
When he's born, everything shakes.
All sentient beings rejoice and attain well-being.
Six kinds of trembling occur in that site of enlightenment.
Māra and his people are all distressed.
That monk turns the wheel of the true Dharma.
He teaches the four noble truths and uses them to subdue the Dharma.
He subdues all the sentient beings of those non-Buddhists.
It comforts the gods and goddesses.
...and all the multitude of ministries.
It causes all sentient beings to come together at all times and in all directions.
Because of the Buddha's merit, they'll obtain the will of the gods.

source_sentence: 若彼求事咸得成就得安樂故得菩提故。
translation: If they pursue their endeavors, they'll all attain them, and it'll be for the sake of their well-being that they'll attain enlightenment.
May all sentient beings be good.
They'll be free of all sins and have no offenders.
...and wriggle all sentient beings.
Their calamities are all removed, and there are no illnesses or disorders.
Where they walk and where they stand.

source_sentence: 於晝於夜及日中時一切安樂。
translation: During the day, night, and midday hours, they're all at ease.
Even then, there are many groups that come together.
They stand on the ground and in space.
They always arouse compassion and abide according to the Dharma.
All the buddhas of this world and beyond.

source_sentence: 乃至諸天常來衛護得大安樂。
translation: Even the gods always come to guard them and obtain great comfort.
After speaking this dhāraṇī, the gods rejoiced and handed it down.
The gods and people rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 佛說大護明大陀羅尼經
translation: Foshuo dabu mingda tuoluoni jing
